name: Poison (General)
description: Poisons are insidious substances that deal damage or inflict conditions through contact, ingestion, inhalation, or injury
trigger: Varies by poison type (contact, ingested, inhaled, or injury)

savingThrow.onSuccess: typically half damage or no effect

contact.description: Contact poison can be smeared on an object and remains potent until it is touched or washed off
contact.application: A creature that touches contact poison with exposed skin suffers its effects

ingested.description: A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects
ingested.application: The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. Partial dose may have reduced effect (GM discretion)

inhaled.description: Poisonous powders and gases take effect when inhaled
inhaled.application: Blowing powder or releasing gas subjects creatures in 5-foot Cube to effect. Cloud dissipates immediately. Holding breath is ineffective
inhaled.note: Affects nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other body parts

injury.description: Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, or similar objects
injury.application: Applied as Bonus Action. Remains potent until delivered through wound or washed off. Delivered through Piercing or Slashing damage

immediate: Varies by poison - may include damage, conditions, or both
ongoing: Some poisons have recurring effects that require repeated saves

acquisition.purchasing: Laws may prohibit possession. May require criminal contacts or unscrupulous apothecary. Extensive inquiries and bribes may be necessary

harvesting.requirements: Venomous creature (dead or Incapacitated), Poisoner's Kit
harvesting.success: Harvest enough poison for single dose, no more can be harvested from that creature
harvesting.criticalFailure: Fail by 5 or more: subjected to creature's poison

detection.method: Typically requires Investigation, Medicine, or Nature checks; some poisons have telltale signs

mitigation: Wear protective gear when handling poisons
Have Poisoner's Kit proficiency for safe handling
Have Resistance or Immunity to Poison damage
Use antidotes or healing magic (Lesser Restoration, Heal)

srdReference.quote: Given their insidious and deadly nature, poisons are a favorite tool among assassins and evil creatures. Poisons come in the following four types: Contact, Ingested, Inhaled, Injury.

examples: Poisoned blade dealing injury poison on hit
Trapped chest handle coated with contact poison
notes: See specific poison files (poison-contact.json, poison-ingested.json, poison-inhaled.json, poison-injury.json) for detailed examples
Prices range from 150 GP to 2,000 GP depending on potency
All sample poisons require Constitution saving throws
